column1: Dubnica nad Váhom (pronunciation ; Slovak before 1927: Dubnica
column4: before 1899 Dubnic(z)) is a town in the Ilava District

column1: It is located on the Váh river
column3: between the White Carpathians and Strážovské vrchy mountains
column4: at an altitude of 242 metres. The town's cadastral area is composed of Dubnica and "city part" Prejta

column1: Traces of settlement in the place of today's town are from the Stone Age. The first written mention about Dubnica nad Váhom was in 1193 as Dubnicza
column2: when it was a yeoman village. Sometime in the 15th century the village passed to the rule of the Trenčín Castle. After incorporation into Czechoslovakia
column3: construction of a munition factory was negotiated in 1928 and built in 1936. During the Communist Czechoslovakia
column4: it was one of the biggest arms producers in the whole country. After the Velvet Revolution in 1989
column5: the factory was shut down and only fragments are left now.

column4: 1.4% Czechs and 0.2% Roma and 0.2 Hungarians. The religious make-up was 76.7% Roman Catholics
